bug.author: fhingerl
bug.summary: Cannot access notebook servers: Sorry, /jupyter/ is not a valid page
bug.description:
/kind bug
I installed Kubeflow (v1.0 on Kubernetes 1.14) on AWS EKS and all components worked fine. Since the installation did not come with KFServing / KNative, I installed KNative following these instructions: <denchmark-link:https://triggermesh.com/2019/04/installing-knative-on-amazon-web-services-eks/>https://triggermesh.com/2019/04/installing-knative-on-amazon-web-services-eks/</denchmark-link>
After performing above steps, I cannot access my notebook servers and pipelines through the Kubeflow UI anymore. The notebooks servers are still running though (tested with kubectl -n anonymous get notebooks). "Home", "Artifact Store" are all still accessible through the web UI. What did you expect to happen: Notebook servers and pipelines should be accessible through Kubeflow UI. Anything else you would like to add: [Miscellaneous information that will assist in solving the issue.] Environment:
Kubeflow version: 1.0 (dev_local) kfctl version: (use kfctl version): v1.0.1-0-gf3edb9b Kubernetes platform: AWS EKS Kubernetes version: (use kubectl version): v1.17.4 OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release): (local machine) macOS High Sierra, v10.13.6
